DWPG-GT 01: The Sketch Comedy Show    Instructor: Janine DiTullio    Graduate/Undergraduate Writers: Alex Aginian, Kimberly Barrante, Nina Braddock, April Brassard, Josh Daws, Kimberly Dinaro, Rotem Eitan, Jessica Hatem, Kelly Hutchinson, Caroline Kaplan, Gabi Lenhard, Joseph Mango, Dan Marmor, Jaclyn Perlmutter, Sam Reid, Ashley Sims, Cory Terry, Erin Triplett    The Spring 2014 Sketch Comedy Class performed their one-hour sketch show live on April 19, 2014. The show consisted of both live sketches, musical performances, and pre-taped sketches. Situation/Sketch Comedy: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Writing for Television: Situation & Sketch Comedy  FMTV-UT.1102 Studio 4 Credits Course Level: Intermediate (formerly Comedy Workshop)     Prerequisite: Fundamentals of Dramatic and Visual Writing (H56.0033), or Dramatic and Visual Writing II (H56.0032), or Script Writing II (H56.0056). Starting Spring 2010, this course will require Writing the Short Screenplay (H56.1020) or Script Analysis (H56.1084). Course may be repeated.    This course covers the fundamentals of all comedy writing for sketch shows and half-hour sitcoms beginning with a sequence of short comedy writing exercises ala The Daily Show, SNL, Mad TV and The Colbert Report. The primary assignment is to write at least the first act of an existing sitcom. The language and process of finding comedic situations, storylines, pitching ideas and developing the script is examined.
